question.title: What is the primary indication for chest radiography in a patient with acute heart failure?
question.description: A patient presents with acute heart failure and a chest radiograph is ordered. What is the primary indication for this radiograph?

option_a.title: Pulmonary embolism
option_a.description: A pulmonary embolism is a common cause of acute heart failure, and chest radiography may be used to confirm the diagnosis.

option_b.title: Pneumonia
option_b.description: Pneumonia is a common complication of acute heart failure, and chest radiography may be used to diagnose and monitor the patient.

option_c.title: Cardiac tamponade
option_c.description: Cardiac tamponade is a life-threatening condition that can cause acute heart failure, and chest radiography may be used to confirm the diagnosis.

option_d.title: Acute coronary syndrome
option_d.description: Acute coronary syndrome is a common cause of acute heart failure, and chest radiography may be used to confirm the diagnosis.

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct answer is the option that corresponds to the letter 'C'.
